item.title: Netanyahu dismisses cease-fire proposal, angering hostage families
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Rachel Pannett, Sammy Westfall
item.description: European foreign ministers are expressing concern about Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu’s apparent rejection of the proposal and mounting hostilities at the Lebanese border.

item.title: U.K’s Princess Anne hospitalized with head injuries after horse incident
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: According to a palace source, the medical team concluded that Anne’s injuries were consistent with those delivered by a horse’s head or legs. She is expected to recover.

item.title: After attack in Dagestan, Russian officials minimize Islamic State claim
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Robyn Dixon
item.description: Some Russian officials blamed Ukraine and the United States for a terrorist attack in the predominantly Muslim region of Dagestan despite the region’s long legacy of Islamist violence.

item.title: Travis Kelce carries Taylor Swift across stage, sending fans into frenzy
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Ma
item.description: Taylor Swift’s boyfriend, NFL star Travis Kelce, joined her on stage during a surprise Eras Tour appearance at London’s Wembley Stadium.

item.title: The pope’s right-hand man is reshaping the church, becoming a target
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Stefano Pitrelli
item.description: Most Catholics have little sense of the liberal archbishop behind the Vatican’s pronouncements. But critics of the pope see Víctor Manuel Fernández as Enemy No. 2.

item.title: The Philippines needs rice — but young people don’t want to farm it
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall
item.description: Some 2.4 million Filipinos work as rice farmers. But for young people, a rice farmer’s grueling and often impoverished life holds dwindling appeal.

item.title: More than 15 killed in Dagestan, Russia, as gunmen hit multiple sites
item.dc:creator: Natalia Abbakumova, Sammy Westfall
item.description: The dead included a 66-year-old Orthodox priest and over 15 police officers in what appeared to be a coordinated attack at a synagogue, church and police post.

item.title: Israeli defense chief heads to D.C. as Hezbollah escalates threats
item.dc:creator: Sarah Dadouch, Kyle Melnick, Niha Masih
item.description: Fears are growing that border clashes between Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah could escalate into all-out war, consuming the Middle East.

item.title: Hajj heat wave deaths underscore climate threat for most vulnerable
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Samuel Oakford
item.description: Many of those who died this month from extreme heat in Saudi Arabia were unregistered pilgrims without access to cooling facilities during the Hajj.

item.title: Iran’s top court overturns death sentence of anti-regime rapper
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Nilo Tabrizy
item.description: Toomaj Salehi, a rare voice of defiance inside Iran, was sentenced to death over his support for the protests sparked by Mahsa Amini’s death.

item.title: He thought a cow ate his Rolex. It turned up five decades later.
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: James Steele, a British dairy farmer, lost the watch while bringing in his cows for milking in the 1970s.

item.title: Yemen’s Houthis undeterred by U.S. campaign to halt Red Sea attacks
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Dan Lamothe, Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: Recent attacks by Houthi fighters on commercial ships in the Red Sea have underscored the group’s ability to pose a sustained threat.

item.title: Israeli airstrikes kill dozens in Gaza City, authorities say
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Mohamad El Chamaa, Lior Soroka
item.description: Israeli strikes killed 38 people in four neighborhoods Saturday, the Gaza civil defense force said. The military said it struck Hamas infrastructure in the city.

item.title: Taylor Swift fever sweeps London, reaches royal family
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Taylor Swift posed for a selfie with Prince William and his eldest children, Princess Charlotte and Prince George, as the star kicked off concerts in London.
